name: La Quinta Inn Miami Airport North

reviews.title: If you enjoy the smell of Mildew...this is the place for you
reviews.text: Well we got there pretty late at night after a flight from Toronto Canada. We took their shuttle from the airport to the hotel and I would say DO NOT EVER take their shuttle. The male driver flew down the roads hitting the gas and brake simultaneously and was cutting in and out of traffic. I thought I was going to die.

So once we get to the place the front desk agent was very nice and informative. We walk to our room passing the pool and seeing leaves and other floating stuff in it. Honestly who knows when the last time it was cleaned?!? So we now enter the room and a strong musty mildewy smell hits us and almost makes us pass out. The room was very plain and had nothing special to it. The bathroom was great...clean to the eye and very spacious...just what four girlz need.
reviews.title: Creepy - Last Resort Only
Not as bad as these reviews say
reviews.text: So it's been 10 months since I'd seen my sister and mom and we wanted to go out and have some drinks as this trip was for my 21st birthday. Yeah it is the sketchiest neighbour hood EVER!!! We were told to go next door to this apparent club. If you're into clubs that have metal doors with no windows to see in then that is the place for you. There is nothing around this hotel.. no good food places..no pubs to relax in...NOTHING!!! So we ask the front desk agent where a nice pub is and she tells us about one and it was great but a ways away.

reviews.title: disgusting
reviews.text: This hotel was unbearable. Our first room was not clean - the bed had lots of hairs in it and a table was covered in spills. Clearly, it had not been cleaned. When we requested another room, we were moved to a room that had a large window that would not close or lock - meaning someone could easily get into our room at any time. Since we felt unsafe, we asked for another room. The third room was still not clean. The water from the tap was brown. The floor was not vacuumed. We stayed but I could not wait to leave. I will never stay at La Quinta again.

reviews.title: Filthy
reviews.text: We booked this room because it was close to the airport & has wireless internet in all the rooms. The wireless internet worked well, but that's the only nice thing I can say about this place. The room was disgusting. There were used Q-tips behind the bed & under the table. The bathroom had someone else's hair all over the sink. I picked up the alarm clock to set it and a mysterious liquid that was underneath it dripped all over my hand & arm. The pillows reeked of cheap perfume, which made it difficult to sleep. The coffee maker was missing the coffee pot. There were people going in and out of rooms all night & making a lot of noise. The sheets had old stains on them & the room smelled like cat urine. We didn't get a do not disturb sign and the maid woke us up at 9am. Plus the area is not nice - there is a gun store rght next door. There are plenty of other places to stay near the MIA airport - don't stay here!!!

I stayed for two nights: with fees paid $62.00 on Hotwire per night. Very nice reception. Room was large and well laid out. Big breakfast included. Location is excellent. I lived very nearby in Miami Springs for sixteen years, so while the neighborhood doesn't look like much I know it is just "airport industrial", and safe. On the same street two or three miles past nice office parks to the west are all sorts of great restaurants. Will return, in all likellihood.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel
Do NOT Recommend
reviews.text: Got this room for $52 through Priceline. I am originally from Miami and my company is based in the direct area, so staying at this hotel was great as far as location is concerned...next to all the major expressways, close to food, entertainment, etc. Unfortunately, this is the best comment I can make about this hotel. They are still recovering (a yr later?) from hurricane Wilma and more than half the rooms are not in service. The rooms themselves were fine, standard rooms. We did detect a slight mildew smell due to the water leakage but could not see any signs of water damage. We could not get extra pillows the first night of our stay and had to beg the housekeeper for them the next day. Our room was not made up the next day, although we left the room before 1pm. When we complained, we were given extra towls. Next day I called the front desk AGAIN to make sure our room was made. When we came home that night, only the bed and the towels had been touched, nothing else. The garbage was piled up, the carpet had not been vacuumed, the mirror in the bathroom was gross, no toilet paper; in other words, only the bare minimum had been done. We complained again. The GM gave us a refund of two nights, which we are still waiting for from Priceline. Another problem was check in. The young lady assured us that there were no pay per view movies and would not need to swipe our credit card. When we got to the room and saw that there WERE movies, we tried to order and had to go to the front desk at 12 midnight to have our card swiped then. Last warning: there is a night club in the strip mall next door that provides a hangout for a lot of younger adults. I saw a lot of those patrons renting rooms as soon as they left the nightclub, if you know what I mean. They were using it as a motel; I saw most of these rooms being dis-occupied within a few hours after they had checked in. Not a great place to have your kids. Be warned.

reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience I've Had
reviews.text: All of the reviews posted so far give an accurate description of the less than impressive property (the pool / hot tub is the best part), and the indifferent, defensive staff that we were forced to deal with when, after returning from dinner, we discovered that our room had been broken into and many of our things stolen. The front desk staff was so unaccommodating and unresponsive that they made us feel as if the theft were our fault. Despite the fact that we filed an official report with the police, contacted La Quinta coprorate headquarters, and followed up with legal filings, we were not compensated for anything. I was surprised to learn that one of the previous customers receieved a voucher for a free night due to service complaints -- not only did we have to pay for our stay that night, we were not offered any alternative compensation. Not that a free night would have made any difference - we will never stay at a La Quinta property again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: this place is the pits

reviews.text: Sunday night we found that the bed was miserably uncomfortable. Come to find out that when they cleaned our room they had removed the mattress cover. Just a bare sheet between us and a very used mattress. They say the renovated. A paint job doesn't constitute renovations in my mind. My husband could not sit on the edge of the bed to put on clothes because of the obvious hole or low spot in the cheap mattress. Also, our bathroom stunk of mold and mildew.
reviews.title: Lots of service problems

likes.liked: — The room was reasonably clean and reasonably quiet.
likes.disliked: — The staff at the desk were unsympathetic about problems and reluctant to help.

reviews.title: Love the clean and newly renovated place to stay!
reviews.text: Our phone had a message light illuminated and although we had no messages, two calls to the front desk went without resolution. Apparently no one knew how to fix it so we had to put the phone on the floor and cover it with clothes for two nights to keep it from shining in our face.

Returned late on Monday and found at 4 pm our room had not yet been cleaned. Filthy from being out in the everglades we were furious that we had to track someone down to get clean towels so we could take a shower and leave for dinner. While bathing we heard them come to clean the room but they were locked out for obvious reasons. We called the hotel mgmt and told them we'd be gone an hour for dinner and we expected someone to get up there and demanded our room be cleaned.
reviews.title: Cannot understand all of the bad reviews

reviews.text: Came back to find the bed made, no vacumming whatsoever, and 2 towels. No hand towels no wash clothes. and still no mattress cover. At this point we were furious and called the front desk demanding a mattress cover and wash clothes. We were called back a couple of minutes later by a woman who said that they didn't have any wash clothes, all of them had been stolen and they were on order. At this point I lost it......stealing towels I've heard of but not the washclothes. Within 10 minutes another employee showed up with towels, hand towels, and wash clothes. She also put a mattress pad on the bed.
reviews.title: A total dump... Shouldn't have a La Quinta sign outside

likes.disliked: — Dilapidated, run down, disgusting building and hotel rooms

reviews.title: Great Customer Service & Clean Room
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The service was wonderful. I am from Miami and went for a friends wedding. The customer service we received was great, I can't say enough about how nice everyone was. The room was very clean and the area is a nice area for the price. It is pretty centrally located right off of the Palmetto Expressway. I would def. stay at this hotel again.

reviews.title: Nasty, Stay away, old and bad area
reviews.text: We stayed here one night because the LQ North near MIA was full. I wanted to pick a hotel which was close to the airport because we had an early morning flight. I wish I had picked a different hotel. I'm a LQ Returns Rewards member and this was not a Tier 3 hotel by any stretch of the imagination. The rooms may have recently been renovated but the hotel is still very old and our room had a certain overly powering musty smell.

reviews.title: A Good Stay
reviews.text: This LQ is located on the North West corner of the airport. I felt the area was not the nicest in Miami. There's a McDonalds next door and 2 Shell Gas stations just down the block. The 826 Hwy is just one block to the right.

aka: La Quinta Miami Airport North Hotel Miami
